INFORMATION WAS COLLECTED ON THE CONTAINER, LIQUID WAS SOLIDIFIED AND ENTERED AND PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP.

item.title: Report X-2024091238
item.description:
Report X-2024091238

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-22T09:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-12
  • City: BELLEVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO PACKAGE LEAKING WHITE POWDER ON SORT PLATFORM. RESPONDER RESPONDED IN FULL PPE, CART, AND MOST RECENT DECISION TREE. PACKAGE WAS TAKEN TO DMP TO BE PROCESSED. EXTERIOR OF PACKAGE CONTAINED LIMITED QUANTITY DIAMOND LABEL, AND DIRECTIONAL ARROWS. PLASTIC PAIL INSIDE OF THE BOX CONTAINED YELLOW 5.1 OXIDIZER DIAMOND LABEL. MANAGEMENT WAS NOTIFIED. RESPONDER PROCESSED AND DISPOSED OF ACCORDING TO APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET AND DISPOSAL FLOW CHART.

item.title: Report E-2024090364
item.description:
Report E-2024090364

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-22T09:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-23
  • City: ELGIN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 10:41 EST, XPO notified ERTS of damaged cargo located at XEJ. It was reported that (1) 5-gallon metal can of UN1309 "PCA 501 Aluminum Powder" was impacted by a metal pole while unloading the trailer. There was no release from the can. Terminal advised they placed the damaged can into an 85-gallon metal drum. The drum was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024090374
item.description:
Report E-2024090374

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-19T09:21:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-24
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 00:56 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XLA. It was reported that approximately 1-cup of UnisolÂ® Liquid Red BK-50 released from a metal tote due to broken gasket on the tote lid. The release impacted inside of trailer #3172123. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Contractors arrived onsite and replaced the faulty gasket with a new one. The impacted tote body was wiped down for shipment on.

item.title: Report E-2024090318
item.description:
Report E-2024090318

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-05
  • City: MATTESON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 5, 2024, one (1) 1-gallon pail of uN1824 was crushed in transit and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE deployed a bicarbonate/water mixture to the trailer floor to neutralize the product. Granular absorbents were deployed to retrieve all loose product, as well as the bicarbonate/water mixture. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum, The damaged product container was placed into one (1) 5-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024090321
item.description:
Report E-2024090321

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-21
  • City: ROCK ISLAND
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XQC. It was reported that approximately 5 ounces of UN1263 Barn & Outbuilding Semi-Gloss Exterior Oil Bright Red was released from a 5-gallon metal pail due to improper loading by terminal XCF. The release impacted trailer #3191199. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. The damaged pail and clean up debris were containerized into a 20-gallon poly drum, which was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.
